model

Class EmployeeList

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.EmployeeList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class EmployeeList
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This is the class that will hold all of the employees. When an object of this class is initialized, it will be Serializable.
    Version:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public java.lang.Object getEmployee(long id)
                             throws EmployeeNotFoundException
        This is the method that will pass the reference to an Employee in the Employee List.

      • getEmployeeList

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Object> getEmployeeList()
        This is the method that will return the Employee list in the form of a HashMap
        Returns:
        The list of employees in the system

      • setEmployeeList

        public void setEmployeeList(EmployeeList inList)
        This is the method that will allow you to point this object to a different employee list. It will be implemented if there is already an employee list on record.
        Parameters:
        inList - The employee list that is already stored

        public void clearList()
        This is the method that will clear the employee list.
